name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: A national movement that sought justice for Breonna Taylor was embraced by celebrities and politicians. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, what happens to that movement now?
https://t.co/j0JnhnDZdd

name: NPR
text:
Rio de Janeiro's Carnival has been postponed for the first time in over 100 years because of the coronavirus.

"Many people depend on it, it's an industry," a historian says. Still, he agrees with the decision. "Financial loss doesn't justify human loss."
https://t.co/lj4nWX8WpX

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: A federal judge has ousted President Trump's top public lands official, who'd served for more than year without Senate confirmation. 

Before taking on the role, he'd advocated for selling the federal public lands that he subsequently managed.
https://t.co/h51dUAnUwN

name: NPR
text:
Two former nursing home leaders are facing criminal neglect charges after allegedly deciding "to combine 42 veterans – some COVID-positive, and others not even showing any symptoms of COVID – into a single unit."

At least 76 veterans died in an outbreak.
 https://t.co/WZhhPfX3re

name: NPR
text: Biden called Trump's refusal to commit to a peaceful transfer of power if he loses the election "a typical Trump distraction" — adding that he's doing so "to take our eye off the ball, not to talk about what's happening to the people dying." https://t.co/A8cG7u1XG9
